title: NFTs for Architecture & STEM
description: 建築やSTEMにおけるIPとしてのNFTの市場が拡大しています。この市場をカルダノシステムに取り込むには、どのような戦略が最適でしょうか？

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal highlighted a problem and proposed a solution which can be implemented on a technical level but i find it too early to request for full funding of the project when the "Detailed plan " section of the proposal clearly stated "Based on input from working architects, engineers and science illustrators, we will present a collection of use-cases and articulate a set of requirements developers should take into account when building dApps for 2D and 3D works"- this clearly indicate that consultation has not commenced which implies that requesting for the full funds before the consultation phase is premature for the following reasons:
What happens to the funds when approved and it is discovered based on the input(consultations) that this solution wont work? what happens if more funds will be needed after consultations and funds have already been disbursed for the full project execution?
The proposal will be better off requesting for fund to consult , then whatever finding are gotten can be used for the project execution.
I disagree.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal provided verifiable links of given experience .
The Proposal provided an implementation plan with cost implications which is premature considering consultations have not been done and it is a blind fund request from that standpoint.
I disagree
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal provided sufficient information to audit the progress and success of the proposal though premature as stated earlier.

I disagree.

f6_assessments.q0: Creating a marketplace for use of NFT to represent 2D and 3D models addresses the challenge brief of creating business models with NFT's at the core. Architectural and Engineering plans represented as NFT's will increase the use and number of NFTs on Cardano, thus increasing utility and providing value to the ecosystem. I would like to see the solution to the problem explained in more detail. I would like the team to expand on the architecture behind capturing the models – wallets, minting policy and movement.
f6_assessments.q1: The team provided a link to a team bio page and The team can expand on the task allocation that each member will be responsible for, this way we can better judge whether there is a work overload in one area. I would like the team to expand on the plan to go to market, acquire customers and model contributions. Lastly, the project will require additional funding in future for phase 2, I would like the team to clarify how future funding will be raised.
f6_assessments.q2: The team provided a timeline with a budget. I would like to see the team further develop and define Key Performance Indicators (KPI's) for the project – example "Create 1000 2D NFT models by month 2, or sign up 15 architects by month x, etc"– set measurables for performance and use it as a KPI, then connect the KPI to the milestones on the project roadmap. I would like the team to connect the KPI's and roadmap milestones to the budget, in this way you can track performance and spending over a timeline . As the project stand at the moment, I feel the project will be difficult to audit.

f6_assessments.q0:
A very interesting idea and one which in my opinion (I'm not a construction engineer or working actively within AR, VR or similar space) can spin off into some very interesting use cases which would drive Cardano and NFT adoption. 
As the project aims to provide guidelines and best practices to the community this project would be a trailblazer for similar concepts and spin offs and could drive ADA and NFT utility and usage in a great way.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has put together an overview plan which seems feasibile, they have the expertise necessary (legal expertise is missing from the team but they seem to have strong support for that in the board of advisors).
What seems to be missing is the procurement of the works the teams deem they want to digitize and mint as NFTs and what that might cost.
The team does seem to have many projects in Fund 6 ongoing at the same time, it is an open question if they could pull off all of the projects at once, if all were to be funded.
The proposal also does not include any risk assessment. The potential of not being able to procure high quality, impactful models and drawings is not discussed nor any other risks.
f6_assessments.q2:
The team has put together a time line to roughly estimate why different phases of the project will complete which is good. There are deliverables which can be followed up and audited.

However, their youtube channel does not contain any videos and was setup recently. The company/team at KeplerSCS does not seem to have any proven track record on their site which can be verified, no public GitHub or similar repository.

Overall this does seem legit, but there are some warning flags which the team can address to improve the auditability, like clearer deliverables and deadlines, a repository and links to the different persons on LinkedIn (now there are only links to one of the proposers).

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal delivers a high quality idea to address IP in 2D and 3D Models by with a further presentation of detailed use-cases. While this provides a useful requirements reference for developers there is less detail on how these requirements would translate to an NFT (concrete examples).
f6_assessments.q1: Extensive experience is documented and biographies are linked to. There is a clear rationale behind the proposal solution to create templates for developers.
f6_assessments.q2: Although clear milestones are indicated - there is a lack of detail in the timeline and budget. No Key Performance Indicators are given and no risk assessment is provided.

solution: 2Dや3Dの図が展示・売買される際のパラダイムのユースケースを整理する。開発者向けのテンプレートを作成。
experience: 建築、サイエンスイラスト、エンジニアリング、IP、フルスタックデベロッパー、JD、PhD。
